text: [Music]
hi my name is Joshua rangipo and I'm the
CTO of social Vibe social Vibe as a
business has grown dramatically the
people have grown and the traffic has
grown since we actually are in the
advertising business tends to be a very
peaky business it makes sense to use a
cloud computing provider that allows you
to actually dynamically scale your
cluster Down based on current usage our
cluster saw is actually between the peak
hours of 11:00 a.m. to 2 pm. is almost
three times larger than it is between
like the hours of 12:00 a.m. to 5:00
a.m. two things happened in 2009 that
led us to AWS first was actually a very
serious Colo outage the second thing was
actually signing a very large publisher
deal that required a large amount of
scale in a very short period of time
back when we were in the collocation
facility in 2007 through 2009 we were
operating under much more stringent
requirements we had to order Hardware in
advance we couldn't experiment with new
architectures very easily once we moved
over to AWS all those problems went away
we were able to quickly deploy new
architectures test them out in
production we can easily swap new
architectures via the elb load balancers
and if they don't work we can easily
swap back ads has allowed us to be very
efficient in our usage of servers so
instead of buying a thousand servers to
handle the amount of load that we're
going to have for the year we can
actually scale up dynamically based on
the current load that's going through
our system of course we use ec2 all of
our current application servers are
running on ec2 and we actually use it
for some of our database servers moving
to AWS allowed us to actually very
easily separate our servers across
multiple AES and in our case we actually
run a hot backup in a separate region
one of the more interesting projects for
us at AWS is Dynamo DB we used it for
our recent open rtb compliant ad server
that was launched 3 months ago and we've
been very happy with the product the
other area of interest for us is
actually multi-region deployments social
Vibes expanded internationally recently
we have a lot of campaigns that we run
in Europe and some in Asia and having
localized Regional deployments in those
regions reduces our latency a great deal
I don't think it would have been
possible to reach the same level of
performance and scalability without
[Music]
AWS
